author: imarches
body:
Solution to the issue discussed here: https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/22608

Switch back to standard pfCandidates for b tagging also for Puppi jets, reverting the change introduced in: https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/18666

This change was introduced as it was giving some b tagging performance improvement for Phase2, which is not there anymore with the new Puppi cuts for Phase 2.

Going back to pfCandidates for b tagging recovers in a satisfactory way the performance as shown in the red curves below. It's also a safer choice as it does not expose b tagging to changes in the Puppi algorithm and its parameters.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4941296/37722408-3e69aae2-2d2c-11e8-9541-3443b6fb906f.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4941296/37722434-4d406db2-2d2c-11e8-8a02-e23b98041e37.png)

The performance of the red curves (standard b tagging with pfCandidates and Phase 2 Puppi cuts) is close now to the black curves, using special custom Phase 2 cuts, which was essentially the attempted solution in https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/22608.

The PR can be backported to 93X and included in: https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/22554
title: Switch to pfCandidates for b tagging for Puppi jets
